dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Thirimanne b Priyanjan 49 (86b 2x4 1x6 110m) SR: 56.97

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Mahmudullah/Rubel Hossain) 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: run out chance, and Bangladesh gleefully take it, Mahela is gone for a duck, Thirimanne punches to cover and sets off, Mahela responds with a sprint that takes him more than half way up the track, Thirimanne sees Mahmudullah get to the ball with a dive and abandons the idea of a run, Mahela has no chance of making it back as the throw comes in to the bowler, who does well to gather it on the run and take the bails off

dismissalComment.html: confusion between the batsmen, and Bangladesh make the most of it, Perera smashed a full one back to the bowler, it hit his hands and went to mid off, they wanted to take the single, then hesitated, then scrambled for it, a direct hit was needed and a direct hit was produced by Rubel, catching Perera way short

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: having painstakingly piloted the ship ashore, Mathews allows himself some release, seals the win with a slog over midwicket, and with an over to spare

commentPostTextItems.html: The big final on Saturday remains in this Asia Cup. Pakistan v Sri Lanka. Join us for that. Good bye.

Mathews is the Man of the Match. Mathews: "I was under a little bit of pressure to be honest. We were losing wickets and had to consolidate. Chaturanga batted beautifully. It is a good problem for us (when Malinga comes back). All the bowlers did well. We wanted to try out a few things (v Bangladesh), wanted to chase and see how we go about it. It was not easy once we lost a few wickets. (Mahela) is a big match player and I am sure he will come good for us."

Mushfiqur: "All four games we fought well apart from Afghanistan. We dropped couple of catches, batsmen got in and got out. We have couple of areas to work on. Missed the injured players, it is not an excuse. We had a chat and said what we showed against Afghanistan was not good enough for international cricket, and was disappointing for the fans. Hopefully we will come hard in the World T20, thanks for supporting us."

Sri Lanka will play the final with four wins in four, and Bangladesh end with their fourth loss in as many games. Sri Lanka were 75 for 5 but they had their calm captain to guide them through on a difficult pitch
Kashif Muneer: "@Arslan Satti - I don't think anyone besides Matthews can gain any confidence from such a batting performance. Matthews hardly needs any more confidence to be honest."
Uwaisul Karnain: "Just about 42 hours left for my nails to grow up before the final. What a series this has been!"
jazeel: "What a turnaround from SL... From losing all the matches in Asia Cup 2012 in BD to winning all the matches in Asia Cup 2014"
Nonymous: "Really deserves a 100 does Angelo. Captain's innings yet again!"

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: flatter delivery worked wide of mid on for a single to level the scores
overpitched ball drilled down to long off
goes for it again, but it is a thick inside edge this time that runs to long on

commentPreTextItems.html: Arslan Satti: "Losing in form Sanga early today could be blessing in disguise. This chase would give SL middle oder confidence for final."

commentTextItems.html: Senanayake has found the boundary, tossed up around off and middle, and he smears it straight down the ground, beats long on comfortably
full toss but Mathews only taps it through square leg for one
Mathews calmly keeps strike with a push in the gap past cover

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: a full toss hit to mid off, he has a go at the non-striker's end, and misses, but Senanayake would have made it anyway
angled in to off stump now, pushed back to the bowler
leans forward to a pitched up ball outside off and pushes to point
short and wide now, but Mathews can slap it away only for a single to the sweeper

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera run out (Rubel Hossain) 15 (23b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 65.21

commentTextItems.html: confusion between the batsmen, and Bangladesh make the most of it, Perera smashed a full one back to the bowler, it hit his hands and went to mid off, they wanted to take the single, then hesitated, then scrambled for it, a direct hit was needed and a direct hit was produced by Rubel, catching Perera way short
pulled down to long on for a single

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: almost got him, he tried to force this length ball, it looped in the air but wide of extra cover
worked out to deep midwicket, they settle for one in the end
gets some room and cuts hard to the sweeper
still just nudging it around, behind square leg for one more
swivels and tries to pull this one as it heads down the leg side, misses

commentPreTextItems.html: Rubel appeared set to bowl this over, but now Mahmudullah has been chosen

commentTextItems.html: whips a full delivery to long on
forced through vacant midwicket but the man in the deep runs forward to keep them to one

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman lbw b Mendis 39 (57b 6x4 0x6 67m) SR: 68.42

dismissalComment.html: given eventually by umpire Oxenford as Mendis implores a second time, tossed up on middle and leg and hitting him on the pad as he misses with the bat, was that headed down leg? Nope, replays show that hitting leg, umpire's call

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque b Mendis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: knocked him over, Mominul is rooted to the crease as Mendis tossed this up high, should have been forward really to such a full length, tries to play half-heartedly from the crease, and it spins away from middle and leg to uproot off stump

headshotImage.caption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chaturanga de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b de Silva 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: they get Mushfiqur now, the captain goes down for a scoop, misses, and is hit on the pad with one that comes in with the angle, umpire Bowden agrees with Sanga's loud appeal, that was hitting middle and leg, replays say

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Thirimanne b Priyanjan 49 (86b 2x4 1x6 110m) SR: 56.97

dismissalComment.html: Thirimanne pulls off a cracker of a catch at midwicket, Anamul flicked in the air, Thirimanne jumped and stretched out his hands over his head to reach the ball, but could only parry it behind him, he fell to the ground, recovered quickly enough to rush back and take it low with another dive

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Mathews b Priyanjan 20 (32b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: he's gone this time though, tried to repeat the stroke with another dash down the track, this one did not turn though, and the thick inside edge looped tamely to midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Lakmal 30 (41b 2x4 0x6 43m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: off stump uprooted, Mahmudullah has been backing away outside leg, tried that again, but Lakmal homed this yorker quick and under the swish of the bat

headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Jayawardene b Lakmal 30 (49b 1x4 0x6 65m) SR: 61.22

dismissalComment.html: Nasir's struggle is over, he heaves at a short of a length ball and the mishit sails to Mahela who comes in from long on to take it

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman b NLTC Perera 12 (14b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: gone this time, a slower one from the back of the hand, it arrives full at him, but is also dipping and goes past his swinging bat and cuts into off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b NLTC Perera 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c †Anamul Haque b Al-Amin Hossain 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's gone second ball, a nippy back of a length delivery going across, Kusal has a go at it, and edges it through to the keeper

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Arafat Sunny
dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Rubel Hossain b Arafat Sunny 33 (60b 3x4 0x6 101m) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: Thirimanne holes out, he's gone for a big hit to a tossed up ball, but hasn't quite got the distance, Rubel has put in a run from long on, and taken a superbly judged catch at the edge of the straight boundary

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Nasir Hossain b Al-Amin Hossain 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: they have the big fish, Sanga is gone early, reaching out and trying a drive to one leaving him from a good length, and edging to first slip, came in at around chest height, popped out on the first try but was gobbled up on the second

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Mahmudullah/Rubel Hossain) 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: run out chance, and Bangladesh gleefully take it, Mahela is gone for a duck, Thirimanne punches to cover and sets off, Mahela responds with a sprint that takes him more than half way up the track, Thirimanne sees Mahmudullah get to the ball with a dive and abandons the idea of a run, Mahela has no chance of making it back as the throw comes in to the bowler, who does well to gather it on the run and take the bails off

dismissalComment.html: he's been given this time, keeper went up as soon as he took this one, umpire Oxenford raises the finger, de Silva has had a big slog at this tossed up ball, there was a sound, the ball seems to have brushed the thigh pad

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera run out (Rubel Hossain) 15 (23b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 65.21

dismissalComment.html: confusion between the batsmen, and Bangladesh make the most of it, Perera smashed a full one back to the bowler, it hit his hands and went to mid off, they wanted to take the single, then hesitated, then scrambled for it, a direct hit was needed and a direct hit was produced by Rubel, catching Perera way short

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

seriesStandings.notes:
Preliminary Matches Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced. refer to Appendix 6 Final Match or Series If no result is achieved in a final the match shall be declared drawn. In the event of a drawn final, the teams will be declared as Joint Champion and the prize money will be shared equally between the two competing teams.

recentReportStory.title: Mathews keeps Bangladesh winless
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
recentReportStory.summary: Sri Lanka's spinners effected a mid-innings trauma, before Angelo Mathews' collected 74 not out overcame a collapse of their own, to extend Sri Lanka's unbeaten run in Bangladesh
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Angelo Mathews works the ball into the leg side
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews works the ball into the leg side , Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur, March 6, 2014

recentReportStory.credit: Andrew Fidel Fernando is ESPNcricinfo's Sri Lanka correspondent. He tweets here
